description: Keep within maximum journey times when you travel so you don't pay more for your journey

breadcrumbs.title: How to pay and where to buy tickets and Oyster

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Keep within the maximum journey time when you travel so you don't pay more for your journey."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
We set maximum times for all pay as you go journeys on the Tube, DLR, London Overground, TfL Rail and National Rail services.
If you spend longer than the maximum journey time, you could be charged a maximum fare:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["up to £10.50 in Zones 1-9","up to £25 if travelling to Heathrow on Heathrow Express","up to £19.80 outside of London zones"]}
To pay the right fare, always touch in at the start of your journey and touch out at the end on yellow card readers.
Every journey has its own maximum journey time, whatever route you take. This depends on the number of zones you cross, the day of the week and the time you're travelling.
